title: Gay and Proud
creator: Kameny, Frank; Rivera, Sylvia; Vincenz, Lilli; Witt, Clifton R.
description: A documentary short film featuring one of the earliest gay pride demonstration marches, the first Christopher Street Liberation Day March, held in New York, New York, on June 28, 1970, to commemorate the first anniversary of the Stonewall Riots. Covering about fifty blocks and drawing just a few thousand participants, it and marches like it held the same year in Chicago, San Francisco, and Los Angeles eventually led to hundreds of Pride parades throughout the world in the following decades.
subject: Documentary Films; Nonfiction Films; Short Films; Gay activists; Gay rights, Gay Liberation Movement; Gay pride day; Gay pride parades; Christopher Street liberation day; New York; New York (State); Demonstrations -- New York (N.Y.); Demonstrations -- New York (State) -- New York; Robert Clement; John Darcy Noble; Church of the Beloved Disciple;
source: Lilli M. Vincenz Collection, Library of Congress, https://lccn.loc.gov/2024603228
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Credit Line: Library of Congress, Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division.

title: Gay and Proud excerpts
creator: Kameny, Frank; Rivera, Sylvia; Vincenz, Lilli; Witt, Clifton R.
description: Excerpts featuring Fr. Robert Mary Clement and John Darcy Noble's participation in the first Christopher Street Liberation Day March. Clips taken from a documentary short film featuring one of the earliest gay pride demonstration marches, the first Christopher Street Liberation Day March, held in New York, New York, on June 28, 1970, to commemorate the first anniversary of the Stonewall Riots. Covering about fifty blocks and drawing just a few thousand participants, it and marches like it held the same year in Chicago, San Francisco, and Los Angeles eventually led to hundreds of Pride parades throughout the world in the following decades.
subject: Documentary Films; Nonfiction Films; Short Films; Gay activists; Gay rights, Gay Liberation Movement; Gay pride day; Gay pride parades; Christopher Street liberation day; New York; New York (State); Demonstrations -- New York (N.Y.); Demonstrations -- New York (State) -- New York; Robert Clement; John Darcy Noble; Church of the Beloved Disciple;
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Credit Line: Library of Congress, Motion Picture, Broadcasting, and Recorded Sound Division.
image_alt_text: Excerpts of Clement and Noble from time 03:28-03:35 and 10:09-10:24 in the original documentary.
object_transcript:
[crowd chanting] 

Reporter: What is the American Church? 
Clement: It’s a sacramental catholic church devoted to the needs of gay people. It’s a homophile community.

[crowds chanting]

[voice over from an interview with another parade participant…]

title: Archbishop Clement: Courage & Activism
creator: Clement, Robert Mary
description: Archbishop Robert Mary Clement reminisces about his days in the gay liberation movement of the late 1960s and compares that struggle to today's social justice protests in Trump's America.
